Articles.Content:
@Elowiny, I found a candidate for the better Yof Texture:

![6jtXPf7.png](http://i.imgur.com/6jtXPf7.png)

Tell me if this is better for Yof, as Sawob (Yof's binary partner) is blue.

Also, I can do cloudcover for Yof and Sawob right for now, but I think I can only do Sawob since it's map won't change.

And Yes, I will put you on the contributor's list.

Do Keep in mind that Kinern's textures have to be as close as possible to the "placeholder (yet we've been using it for a while)."

Also, I may have found a texture for HD101b:

![fbFhNlI.png](http://i.imgur.com/fbFhNlI.png)

What do you guys think?

After all, HD101b is a reddish world, and has a dark color scheme.

> 
> @Elowiny, I found a candidate for the better Yof Texture:
> [http://i.imgur.com/6jtXPf7.png](http://i.imgur.com/6jtXPf7.png) 
> 
> Tell me if this is better for Yof, as Sawob (Yof's binary partner) is blue.
> 
> Also, I can do cloudcover for Yof and Sawob right for now, but I think I can only do Sawob since it's map won't change.
> 
> And Yes, I will put you on the contributor's list.
> 
> Do Keep in mind that Kinern's textures have to be as close as possible to the "placeholder (yet we've been using it for a while)."
> 
> Also, I may have found a texture for HD101b:
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/fbFhNlI.png](http://i.imgur.com/fbFhNlI.png)
> 
> What do you guys think?
> 
> After all, HD101b is a reddish world, and has a dark color scheme.

Hmmm...Yof's texture is perfect, and HD101b's texture seems good. Could you post a screenshot of the planet with the new texture?
I haven't applied them yet; I just want to know how everything looks to you guys.

Well, you've all been busy. I've been slacking a bit, though, just finished my high school transfer forms, and family came to visit for the next few weeks.

So, other than that, hows everyone doing?

Can I also get a link to the latest version of the pack?

Astro, I like the textures that you picked for Yof and HD101b, very nice.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-09T02:57:09Z" title="08/09/2015 02:57  AM" data-short="8 yr">August 9, 2015</time> by Hammersamatom**

I'll get one up tomorrow, but tomorrow may be the last you hear from me in a while, as school for me starts the 10th. You should know how the Early college is...

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-09T16:18:38Z" title="08/09/2015 04:18  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 9, 2015</time> by Astrofox**

Here's an update for this pack!

[The Exoplanet Pack and System Expansion - formerly known as Astro's Kopernicus Planets](https://www.dropbox.com/sh/s2welqyol7hs3u6/AAALdIXL5fpd_voWQ6Tx_1xOa?dl=0).

Have fun and send in some suggestions by the end of today, as I am going to school tomorrow and I won't be able to do too much unless I have a holiday or something like that.

ChangeLog!

-Added moon and rings to Corit (2KASS404c)

-moved some moons so that you don't collide with them before even entering the SOI.

-Added 2KASS404d "Contiron"

-New texture for Yof and HD101b (we need a Kinern Texture that is closer to actual Kinern).

Thng we need to do:

- fix the light bugs, move the stars farther out (can anyone put those values in properly?)

-Make 2KASS404 emit light and give off solar panel EC without completely re-modeling it

-Add Devo, and add a comet tail to both Devo and Comer

-Maybe a few asteroids around HD100, as well as Braun (2KASS404).

-Maybe some other things.
I downloaded the mod, but it says it might have a virus or spyware.

Which anti-virus program are you using? See this mention of Norton Antivirus giving false positives with Ferram Aerospace Research.

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/20451-1-0-4-Ferram-Aerospace-Research-v0-15-4-1-Goldstein-7-29-15?p=2128760&viewfull=1#post2128760](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/20451-1-0-4-Ferram-Aerospace-Research-v0-15-4-1-Goldstein-7-29-15?p=2128760&viewfull=1#post2128760)

Essentially Norton is applying the "No credit is bad credit" principle to anti-virus.
i have Norton online backup on my computer, so that might be the problem. Thanks!

I hope to see you guys as soon as possible, but don't worry, I'll try to reply whenever there is a problem.

Until then, goodbye for now.

Going on vacation, I won't be able to do biome maps.

I'll be home in 2 days
I'm to bussy fixing my mod and I anyway don't have enough time.
I've got to say I like the planet pack a lot. The looks are very appealing, specifically the colors. Good luck on this mod!
Still busy, I may have time this weekend though, but I probably won't. Hopefully I will.
This looks quite promising! Hey, I could help with Environmental Visual Enhancements configs if you'd like! For example, I'm currently making the cloud maps and configs for planet Arkas by CoriW.

> 
> This looks quite promising! Hey, I could help with Environmental Visual Enhancements configs if you'd like! For example, I'm currently making the cloud maps and configs for planet Arkas by CoriW.

Eh send me a PM... I might have a... deal for yeu, if you may...
For binary planets: use SigmaBinary.

We're using such technology.

Anyway, I'm back for fall break, i.e. until round tuesday of next week. Let's get back to work, shall we?
Yea (5chars)

So, about the retro Kerbin...

Perhaps you can make a planet called "Nibrek," the reverse spelling of Kerbin, and give it the exact orbital parameters as the current Kerbin. Except you put it on the opposite side of Kerbol for an interesting journey to it. ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)
Sorry for possible le necropost, but I support that idea.

No problem, I haven't had much time to experiment.

 Although, I have been trying to add a small asteroid close to 2KASS404.

 I also got finished with a Kinern mission several weeks ago to just test my abilities after a long time of being offline.

 Note: don't exit to the space center if you have a craft within at least 5-10km from the surface of a planet, otherwise the game will delete the object as the game thinks the object is gong to crash.

This is an important case for the moons of Kinern.

Also, I command that this shall not be a "necropost" as I am the creator of this thread.
What's up everyone...
Nothing much other than 1.0.5's release today...
How has the development been going? It's been a month since the last status post...
